meanings.sent2: The constant buzzing yirks my ears.
meanings.sent3: The way he chews gum loudly really yirks me.
meanings.sent4: The dripping faucet yirks my patience like a slow leak in a dam.
meanings.sent5: Her persistent questions yirks my concentration like a buzzing fly.

meanings.definition: Yirks (noun): a feeling of annoyance or irritation
meanings.sent1: His constant tapping gave me the yirks.
meanings.sent2: The yirks from the noisy neighbors kept me up all night.
meanings.sent3: Getting stuck in traffic always gives me the yirks.
meanings.sent4: The yirks crawled up my spine like tiny ants.
meanings.sent5: The yirks in my stomach felt like a swarm of bees buzzing around.
